website_summaries.verdict: An older-style computer that performs well, at an attractive price point. A bit heavy to be truly portable.
pros: 15.6-inch Full HD screen and GeForce GTX 1060 graphics card
16GB of RAM supports virtually any game
cons: A heavy model that does not lend itself to portability

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE - poor computer, worse service
customer_reviews.text: I bought this computer barely a month ago, and have already suffered a hardware malfunction that has fried the motherboard. Upon contacting Dell, the only option made available was to wait for a box to be sent to me, to send the computer back to them, to be repaired. For a $1,500 computer, I expect much better from them. This is putting me out of work, which in essence doubled the cost of this computer, assuming I get it back in the estimated week they offered. Frankly, I find it incredible they can’t offer anything more customer-friendly for a computer that is 5 weeks old, and cost this much.
customer_reviews.author: idoitfor

customer_reviews.title: I like this laptop a lot but its too heavy
customer_reviews.text: I like this laptop a lot! I'm an architecture student and the speed and graphics are awesome! There are some things that concerns me a bit, it gets too warm while running it, sometimes it makes a beep sound and freezes out of nowhere. The last thing was solved by contacting dell and changing the configuration. If you are looking for a laptop to carry around with you, this is not it! Its pretty heavy.
customer_reviews.author: ealeen

customer_reviews.title: BUYER BEWARE
customer_reviews.text: I bought this BRAND NEW $1249.00 computer and received a USED computer. It's DIRTY, has someone else's login, and has dirty finger prints EVERYWHERE!!!
customer_reviews.author: TIna Seydel

customer_reviews.title: Problems out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Wireless card is littered with problems. The entire machine was littered with problems.
customer_reviews.author: John C.

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: It was a present for my husband and he loves it. It runs all of his games ubisoft, Blizzard and microsoft. He has abandoned his ps4 pro....lol
customer_reviews.author: Jrw

customer_reviews.title: Seriously, don’t bother
customer_reviews.text: When we turned it on it said the battery had failed. Returned it. Now it’s taking forever to get a replacement
customer_reviews.author: SamP

customer_reviews.title: return it because the size
customer_reviews.text: size is too big and too heavy for the businessman but I had to said its not the seller fault, just choose the wrong laptop for me .
customer_reviews.author: Dophigo

customer_reviews.title: Dead battery
customer_reviews.text: Mine came broken “battery permanent failure” straight out of the box. I can run games and stuff and it’s great but I can’t unplug it or it shuts off, but other than that’s it’s amazing I love it... u will have to get more SSD’s tho it only comes with 100 gigs and that is half taken up by pre downloaded software
customer_reviews.author: mason

customer_reviews.title: Will not work too long, not a good product
customer_reviews.text: If you buy a battery for less than a year, it will not work anymore. It will shut down after leaving the power supply. It takes 15 minutes to boot up. You will never buy any electronic products on Amazon. There is no guarantee.
customer_reviews.author: Natalia Cayla

customer_reviews.title: Battery life
customer_reviews.text: Everything is good except the battery. I get only one hour and 30 mins? Is it just me or the battery is bad?
customer_reviews.author: Kurt

customer_reviews.title: It's decent once you figure out how to fully work it.
customer_reviews.text: Decent little machine, sometimes It'll give you a pain. I've had numerous problems with it, but it's been working smooth so far. Great for playing 60-100 FPS on max settings, but it does get a little toasty.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Dunn

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Gaming Laptop
customer_reviews.text: My 14 year old got this for Christmas . He loves it very smooth, a bit heavy but very good Price ! I would recommend upgrading ssd to 1 Tb for faster speed .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dosnt work!!
customer_reviews.text: Came to me broken in mail computer memory chip was faulty and screen was completely black had dont buy!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Nick medina

customer_reviews.title: Two Defective Devices
customer_reviews.text: Received two defective products. Maybe a bad batch idk but ended up returning both.
customer_reviews.author: Trevar S.

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: This replaced another older Alien for my grandson, he is very happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: Don Williams

customer_reviews.text: Good product but it gets hot and low battery life but expect with the quality
customer_reviews.author: Adam Bowlen

customer_reviews.title: Super Slow
customer_reviews.text: Slowest laptop I've ever owned i will never buy an Alienware pc again. Bought this because is was a previous model and it was on a special but ill go with a desktop next time I want a pc
customer_reviews.author: Austin Schwint

product_meta.title: Dell Alienware R4 15.6" Full HD Gaming Laptop, 8th Gen Intel Core i7-8750H, 16GB Memory, 1TB HDD + 8GB SSD, NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1060 6GB, Windows 10
product_meta.description: Get dangerously deep in the game. The perfect balance of power and portability come together in the Alienware 15 Gaming Laptop.
feature_bullets: 15.6 in Full HD IPS (1920 x 1080), NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1060 6GB GDDR5
Intel 6-Core i7-8750H 9MB cache, 2.20 GHz up to 4.10 GHz, 802.11ac, Bluetooth 5.0, Backlit Keyboard
2 USB Type-A (USB 3.1 Gen 1), 1 USB 3.1 Gen 2, 1 HDMI 2.0, 1 Mini DisplayPort 1.3, 1 Thunderbolt 3 (Supports DisplayPort)
Windows 10 Home 64 bit, 1 Year Warranty, 1 x 1/8" / 3.5 mm Headphone/Microphone Input/Output
1 6GB 2400 MHz DDR4 Memory for fast processing (Maximum Memory Capacity 32GB), 1TB HDD + 8GB SSD.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars46 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
